name: Old Town
excerpt: The ancient walled town overlooking Mala Plaža is largely residential and somewhat dilapidated, a legacy of the 1979 earthquake. This is part of its charm…
detail_description:
The ancient walled town overlooking Mala Plaža is largely residential and somewhat dilapidated, a legacy of the 1979 earthquake. This is part of its charm – this Old Town really does feel old, with its uneven cobblestones and paucity of street lighting. Allow at least an hour to simply ramble around to your heart's content. Whatever else you find, spectacular views of Ulcinj and the beach below are guaranteed.
A steep slope leads to the upper gate, where just inside the walls there’s a small museum containing Roman and Ottoman artefacts and a relief map of the town. On the site is a 1510 church that was converted to a mosque in 1693; you can still see the ruined minaret.Just outside the museum is a 17th-century fountain – these days, it's more like a tap – with an Arabic inscription, a crescent moon and flowers carved into the stone.There has been talk for time immemorial about installing an elevator from Ulcinj's little harbour up to the Old Town, so that everyone – rather than just able-bodied types – can enjoy its ambience. Locals have stopped holding their breath.

name: Top-of-the-Market Mosque
excerpt: Kryepazarit Mosque was built in 1749 at the intersection of the main streets.
detail_description: Kryepazarit Mosque was built in 1749 at the intersection of the main streets.

name: Upper Gate
excerpt: The entrance to the Old Town is reached via a steep slope.
detail_description: The entrance to the Old Town is reached via a steep slope.

name: Pasha’s Mosque
excerpt: The 1719 Pasha's Mosque is an elegant complex with a defunct hammam (Turkish bathhouse) attached.
detail_description: The 1719 Pasha's Mosque is an elegant complex with a defunct hammam (Turkish bathhouse) attached.

name: Lamit Mosque
excerpt: Lamit Mosque dates from 1689 but was substantially rebuilt after the 1979 earthquake. The ceiling has interesting green-painted geometric wood panelling.
detail_description: Lamit Mosque dates from 1689 but was substantially rebuilt after the 1979 earthquake. The ceiling has interesting green-painted geometric wood panelling.

name: Mezjah Mosque
excerpt: Set back slightly from the road, the 1728 Mezjah Mosque is Ulcinj’s main Islamic place of worship. Inside there's a sloping floor and wooden mezzanine.
detail_description: Set back slightly from the road, the 1728 Mezjah Mosque is Ulcinj’s main Islamic place of worship. Inside there's a sloping floor and wooden mezzanine.

name: Ulcinj Museum
excerpt: Just inside the Old Town walls, this small museum houses Roman and Ottoman artefacts and a relief map of the town.
detail_description: Just inside the Old Town walls, this small museum houses Roman and Ottoman artefacts and a relief map of the town.

name: Fountain
excerpt: Just outside the Old Town museum, this 17th-century fountain (these days it's more like a tap) has an Arabic inscription, a crescent moon and flowers…
detail_description: Just outside the Old Town museum, this 17th-century fountain (these days it's more like a tap) has an Arabic inscription, a crescent moon and flowers carved into the stone.

name: Sailors' Mosque
excerpt: Right on the waterfront, this imposing stone structure was completed in 2012, replacing a mosque (destroyed 1931) which predated the Ottomans. The…
detail_description: Right on the waterfront, this imposing stone structure was completed in 2012, replacing a mosque (destroyed 1931) which predated the Ottomans. The original mosque here was once used as a lighthouse. There are some interesting frescoes inside.

name: Hotel Albatros Beach
excerpt: If you feel like getting your kit off without making your way to Ada Bojana, this bare-bum beach just down from the large Hotel Albatros is the place to…
detail_description: If you feel like getting your kit off without making your way to Ada Bojana, this bare-bum beach just down from the large Hotel Albatros is the place to do it. Heading down the path, turn right for the clothed beach and left for the unclothed.

name: Mala Plaža
excerpt: Come July and August it's hard to see this little grin of a cove under all the suntanned flesh. If you're after a little more seclusion, go for a…
detail_description: Come July and August it's hard to see this little grin of a cove under all the suntanned flesh. If you're after a little more seclusion, go for a southeasterly stroll – you'll find a succession of rocky bays and clearer, less-sun-lotion-oiled water.

name: Aquarius Beach
excerpt: If you care more for socialising than sand, this one's for you. The rocky little cove is renowned to locals as the young folks' beach; ear-shatteringly…
detail_description: If you care more for socialising than sand, this one's for you. The rocky little cove is renowned to locals as the young folks' beach; ear-shatteringly loud Top 40 hits, buzzy bars, fast-food offerings and people taking selfies in rented sun loungers prove them right.

name: Sapore di Mare
excerpt: This pine-fringed rocky beach makes for a good break from the blaring pop and incessant preening of some of the more populated strips of sand near Mala…
detail_description: This pine-fringed rocky beach makes for a good break from the blaring pop and incessant preening of some of the more populated strips of sand near Mala Plaža. Despite the lack of sand, it's a good spot for swimming and sunning. There's a nice pizzeria and bar on the concreted terrace.

name: Liberty Monument
excerpt: On the cliff above Mala Plaža, this imposing monument is a lovely piece of socialist art that’s now neglected and covered in graffiti. Its two V-shaped…
detail_description: On the cliff above Mala Plaža, this imposing monument is a lovely piece of socialist art that’s now neglected and covered in graffiti. Its two V-shaped white segments resemble a pair of fighter planes that have crash-landed on their noses. Closer inspection reveals them as stylised wings sprouting from the figures facing each other at the centre.

name: St Nicholas’ Cathedral
excerpt: Colourful frescoes fill this Serbian Orthodox cathedral, set among a picturesque grove of gnarled olive trees just below the main gate to the Old Town. It…
detail_description: Colourful frescoes fill this Serbian Orthodox cathedral, set among a picturesque grove of gnarled olive trees just below the main gate to the Old Town. It’s a relative newbie, having been built in 1890 shortly after the Ottomans were booted out, although it’s believed to stand on the site of a 15th-century monastery.

name: Ladies' Beach
excerpt: This lovely, boulder-strewn little cove – and its cave – are strictly for the ladies. It was given its name and status thanks to the high level of sulphur…
detail_description: This lovely, boulder-strewn little cove – and its cave – are strictly for the ladies. It was given its name and status thanks to the high level of sulphur in the deep green water, said to be an excellent natural treatment for infertility. Local women often swim naked here. If you're not in possession of XX chromosomes, don't even think about it: the area is respected (and guarded) as a haven for women.

name: Mother Theresa statue
excerpt: Aptly located at Ulcinj's medical clinic is a statue of Mother Theresa, the most famous Albanian of recent years (although she was actually born in North…
detail_description: Aptly located at Ulcinj's medical clinic is a statue of Mother Theresa, the most famous Albanian of recent years (although she was actually born in North Macedonia). The statue receives dozen of floral bouquets daily.Adjacent to it is a commemorative plaque reading 'In gratitude to the people of Ulcinj for the humanity, solidarity and hospitality they have shown in sheltering and taking care of the persecuted from Kosova during the period March ‘98 to June ‘99 – Grateful Kosovars’.
